general.study_notes: signr: they identify US monetary shocks by placing sign restrictions on the federal funds rate and on prices in the dollarized countries only; they have annualizaed the impulses response functions despite using monthly frequency, no transformation.

model_notes.model_1: signr: they define a contractionary US monetary policy shock as a shock that does not lead to an increase in the price level in all dollarized countries, and does not lead to a decrease in the federal funds rate.
model_notes.model_2: signr: they define a contractionary US monetary policy shock as a shock that does not lead to an increase in prices (both in the US and in all dollarized countries) and does not lead to a decrease in the federal funds rate.
model_notes.model_3: signr: they define a contractionary US monetary policy shock as a shock that does not lead to an increase in US prices and output, does not increase prices in all four dollarized countries, and does not lead to a decrease in the federal funds rate.
